column1: Dol Tarlang was the northernmost of three peaks (the other two being Cûl Bîn and Cûl Veleg) located in the pass of Tarlangs Neck. The three mountains formed a spur on the southern side of the White Mountains.

column2: Dol Tarlang was in origin the head of the giants Tarlang.J.R.R. Tolkien
column3: Guide to the Names in The Lord of the Rings
column4: omitted entry quoted in Wayne G. Hammond
column6: The Lord of the Rings: A Readers Companion

column1: The name Dol Tarlang is glossed as "Tarlangs Head"
